_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary - North Central Cooperative - Rowan Facility


Accidental, Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
 This facility complies with regulated anhydrous ammonia storage requirements and it is our policy to 
 adhere to all federal, state and local laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the
 Rowan Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

Description of Facility:
 This facility is a retail farm supplier. We sell anhydrous ammonia to famers for the purpose of crop
 production. On site we have a 30,000 gallon and an 8,000 gallon storage tank for anhydrous ammonia.
 These tanks are filled to a amximum of 85% capacity to allow for product expansion.

Worst Case Release Scenario:
 Our worst case scenario is a gas release from one of the storage tanks. According to EPA's RMP Comp
 the distance to endpoint is 3.20 miles. There are residences within the distance to endpoint, with a total
 of 267 peolpe being affected.

Alternative Release Scenario:
Our alternative release scenario is a transfer hose failure. According to EPA's RMP Comp, the distance to end point is 0.20 miles. There are residences within the distance to endpoint with a total of one person being affected.

This facility has excess flow valves and emergency shutoffs in place to minimze the chances of an accident. All personnel are trained annually in the safe operation of the equipment and facility. We have also installed concrete barricades in traffic pattern areas in an effort to eliminate the threat of vehicular accident.

General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:
 This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state and local codes
 and regulations. This facility is annually inspected by in-house personnel and by the Iowa Department
of Agriculture.

Five-Year Accident History:
 We have never had an accident involving anhydrous ammo

nia that caused death, injuries, propert or 
 environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

The Emergency Response Program: 
 In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia facility, it is our policy to notify the Rowan 
 Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with the
 fire departement. Members of the fire departmenthave inspected our anhydrous ammonia facility.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
 None
